snippet: Chris Christie of New Jersey and at least 25 other governors have said they do not want Syrian refugees to come to their states; for decades, Wankel’s has hired people fleeing violence and persecution.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column details how Wankel's hardware store on Upper East Side of Manhattan has for decades hired refugees; contrasts Wankel's longstanding practice with warnings made by elected officials like New Jersey Gov Chris Christie that they do not wish to have any Syrian refugees relocated to their states.
lead_paragraph: Chris Christie of New Jersey and at least 25 other governors have said they do not want Syrian refugees to come to their states; for decades, Wankel’s has hired people fleeing violence and persecution.

headline.print_headline: A Hardware Store Welcomes Refugees as Governors Vow to Shut Them Out
headline.main: A Manhattan Hardware Store Welcomes Refugees as Governors Vow to Shut Them Out
